parameters.name: Unit ID
parameters.description:
0-15 (Default: 0)
Be careful with this setting as it influences the communication with MatriarchSwitch.

parameters.name: 4.6 Tuning Scale
parameters.description:
Matriarch is fully compliant with the MIDI Tuning Standard, so you can import, save, and use tuning scales and intonation systems from around the world. Tuning scales can be accessed via MIDI messages, or by using this Global Setting to select a Tuning scale from the keyboards. The last Tuning scale selected will is remembered when the power is turned off and on again. You can select any tuning table from 0 to 31. Tuning table 0 is permanently set to 12-Tone Equal Temperament.
The Default is 0 (12-TET).

parameters.name: Knob Mode
parameters.description:
I have no idea what this really does.
0 = Snap, 1 = Pass-Thru, 2 = Relative (Default: 2 / Relative)
The real Default is Snap.

parameters.name: 0.1 Note Priority
parameters.description:
Note Priority selects which note will take priority when playing the Matriarch keyboard in monophonic mode. The choices are the highest note played, the lowest note played, or the most recently played note.
Default: Last Note

parameters.name: 1.10 Transmit Program Change
parameters.description: Matriarch can be set to send a MIDI Program Change command (Program Numbers 1 through 12) when the OCT / BANK switch and SEQUENCE knob on the front panel are used to select and load a previously saved sequence from memory. Turning this Global Setting OFF will prevent Program Change commands from being sent when a sequence is selected. The Default is Off.

parameters.name: 1.9 Receive Program Change
parameters.description:
MIDI Program Change commands (Program Numbers 1 through 12) can be used to load a previously saved Matriarch sequence, and make it the active sequence. Turning this Global Setting OFF will prevent errant Program Change commands from inadvertently activating a saved sequence.
The Default is On.

parameters.name: MIDI Input Ports
parameters.description:
0 = none, 1 = DIN only, 2 = USB only, 3 = Both (Default: 3 / Both DIN and USB)
Be careful with this setting as it can inhibit communication with MatriarchSwitch.

parameters.name: MIDI Output Ports
parameters.description:
0 = none, 1 = DIN only, 2 = USB only, 3 = Both (Default: 3 / Both DIN and USB)
Be careful with this setting as it can inhibit communication with MatriarchSwitch.

parameters.name: 1.3 MIDI Echo USB In
parameters.description:
MIDI Echo USB allows MIDI data received at the USB MIDI input to be re-transmitted via the USB MIDI output, the DIN MIDI output, or both.
The Default is No echo.

parameters.name: 1.4 MIDI Echo DIN In
parameters.description:
MIDI Echo DIN allows MIDI data received at the DIN MIDI input to be re-transmitted via the DIN MIDI output, the USB MIDI output, or both.
The Default is No echo.

parameters.name: 1.1 MIDI Channel IN
parameters.description:
Matriarch can send and receive data on any MIDI Channel, from 1 to 16.
The Default is Channel 1.

parameters.name: 1.2 MIDI Channel OUT
parameters.description:
Matriarch can send and receive data on any MIDI Channel, from 1 to 16.
The Default is Channel 1.

parameters.name: 4.10 MIDI Out Filter - Keys
parameters.description:
This setting controls whether or not MIDI Note messages are output in response to playing on the Matriarch keyboard. ON is the setting that allows MIDI notes to be sent.
The Default is On.

parameters.name: 4.9 MIDI Out Filter - Wheels
parameters.description:
This setting controls whether or not MIDI CC messages are output in response to movement of the Pitch Wheel or Mod Wheel. ON is the setting that allows messages to be sent.
The Default is On.

parameters.name: 4.8 MIDI Out FIlter - Panel
parameters.description:
This setting controls whether or not MIDI CC messages are output in response to changes made to the front panel controls. ON is the setting that allows messages to be sent. When MIDI Out Filter - Panel Knobs is OFF, then no MIDI CC messages are output from Grandmother in response to panel control changes.
The Default is On.

parameters.name: Output 14-bit MIDI CCs
parameters.description:
Matriarch can send MIDI CC messages in response to changes on knobs and wheels. These CC messages normally contain a single 7-bit value. If this setting is set to Extended, Matriarch always sends 2 CC messages, achieving a higher 14-bit resolution. Set this only if the other MIDI gear on the chain can cope with it.
The Default is Standard 7-bit.

parameters.name: 1.7+ Local Control: Keys
parameters.description: The Matriarch Keyboard can be disconnected from the internal synth engine, while still outputting MIDI and CV/Gate data. The Default is Connected.

parameters.name: 1.7+ Local Control: Wheels
parameters.description: The Matriarch Pitch, and Modulation wheels can be disconnected from the internal synth engine, while still outputting MIDI and CV. The Default is Connected.

parameters.name: Local Control: Panel
parameters.description:
Some panel knobs (Arp/Seq Rate, Mod Rate, Osc 2/3/4 Freq, Delay Time) can be disconnected from the internal synth engine, wile still outputting MIDI and CV.
The Default is Disconnected.
Does not seem to have any effect in firmware 1.2.1

parameters.name: 1.8 Local Control: Arp/Seq
parameters.description:
The Matriarch Sequencer and Arpeggiator can be disconnected from the internal synth engine, while still outputting MIDI and CV/Gate data.
The Default is Connected.

parameters.name: 2.4 Sequencer Transpose Mode
parameters.description:
The playback of a sequence can be transposed in real time via two methods. The first simply transposes the sequence so that the first note of the pattern is the note being played on the keyboard. The second method assumes Middle C is correct key, and will playback the sequence as it was recorded when Middle C is played. So to transpose the sequence up a Fourth, hold down the F key above Middle C. To transpose the sequence down a Fifth, hold down the G below Middle C.
The Default is Relative to first Note.

parameters.name: 2.7 Arp/Seq Keyed Timing Reset
parameters.description:
The Arp / Seq Keyed Timing Reset changes how the Arpeggiator, the Matriarch master clock, and notes played on the keyboard will interact. When OFF, the Arpeggiator will remain locked to the Master Clock so that notes played ahead of the beat (prior to the next step) will wait for the next beat, or clock step, to sound. When ON, notes played on the keyboard will sound immediately, and the master clock will reset, or sync, to the timing of when the key was pressed.
The Default is On.

parameters.name: 2.8 Arp FW/BW Repeats
parameters.description:
When the DIRECTION switch in the Arp / Seq module is set to FW / BW, this setting will determine whether the first and last notes of an arpeggio pattern or sequence are repeated as the direction changes. This can be handy both melodically and rhythmically. If Repeat is OFF, the three-note sequence [C-E-G] would play as [C-E-G-E-C-E-G-E...]; if Repeat is ON, the same [C-E-G] sequence would now play as [C-E-G-G-E-C-C-E-G-G-E-C...].
The Default is Repeat.

parameters.name: 2.10 Arp/Seq Swing
parameters.description:
Adding Swing to the playback of the Arpeggiator or Sequencer causes the offbeat to arrive Early or Late, in varying amounts, to change the rhythmic feel. Use any of the white keys to set the swing amount, in 2% increments. The range of available values is from 0 to 16383 = 0 to 100%.
The Default is 8192 (50% / no swing)

parameters.name: 2.5 Sequence Keyboard Control
parameters.description:
The keyboard and the Sequencer can operate together or independently. When Sequencer Keyboard Control is ON, pressing a key on the keyboard, or playing a MIDI note will start the sequence and set any transposition of the sequence. When Sequencer Keyboard Control is OFF, the Sequencer operates independently of the keyboard. The active sequence will play immediately at the original recorded pitch when the PLAY button is pressed (lit), while notes played on the Matriarch keyboard (or MIDI notes) can then play along with the Sequencer.
The Default is On.

parameters.name: 2.9 Delay Sequence Change
parameters.description:
The Global Setting for Delay Sequence Change determines how the Sequencer playback will transition from one sequence to another. When the Sequencer is running, changing from one sequence to another will take place instantly (Delay Sequence Change = OFF), or the active sequence will be allowed to finish before the new sequence begins (Delay Sequence Change = ON).
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: 2.6 Sequence Latch Restart
parameters.description:
Sequence Keyed Restart determines the behavior of the Sequencer when Sequence Keyboard Control is ON. When restarting a sequence by playing a key on the keyboard (or a received MIDI note), the sequence can restart from the first note of the sequence (ON), or the sequence can resume playback from where it left off (Off).
The Default is On.

parameters.name: 2.1 Arp/Seq Clock Input Mode
parameters.description:
The CLOCK IN jack on the Matriarch rear panel can work in two different ways: As an analog clock input which sets the tempo of the Sequencer’s internal clock, or as a step-advance trigger input, which advances the Arpeggiator or Sequencer by one step each time a rising-edge trigger is detected at the CLOCK IN jack.
The Default is Clock.

parameters.name: 2.2 Arp/Seq Clock Output
parameters.description:
The Arp / Seq CLOCK OUT jack can be set to constantly send a clock pulse signal, or to send clock pulse signals only when the PLAY button is lit, and the playback of a sequence or Arpeggiator pattern is active.
The Default is Only when playing.

parameters.name: 2.3 ArpSeq MIDI Output
parameters.description:
Matriarch allows the note data generated by an arpeggio or sequence to be output via MIDI, or not.
The Default is On

parameters.name: 1.6+ Send MIDI Clock
parameters.description:
The Matriarch Sequencer and Arpeggiator can be set to output MIDI Clock. Depending on your setup, you may wish for Matriarch to send it Always, Only when Playing, or not at all.
The default is Off.

parameters.name: 1.6+ Send MIDI Start/Stop
parameters.description:
The Matriarch Sequencer and Arpeggiator can be set to output MIDI Start and Stop commands. Depending on your setup, you may wish for Matriarch to not send some of these commands.
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: 1.5+ Follow MIDI Clock
parameters.description:
The Matriarch Sequencer and Arpeggiator can be set to follow MIDI Clock (On), or ignore it (Off).
The Default is On.

parameters.name: 1.5+ Follow MIDI Start/Stop
parameters.description: The Matriarch Sequencer and Arpeggiator can respond to Start and Stop commands received via MIDI (On), or ignore them (Off). The Default is On.

parameters.name: Follow Song Position Pointer
parameters.description:
I have no idea what this really does.
0 = Off, 1 = On (Default: 1 / On)

parameters.name: 3.1 Clock Input PPQN Index
parameters.description:
In order for the Matriarch Sequencer and Arpeggiator to sync correctly to an External Clock, this Global Setting allows you to specify how many pulses are received per quarter note (PPQN).
The Default is 4 PPQN / sixteenth note clock.

parameters.name: 3.2 Clock Output PPQN Index
parameters.description:
In order for an external device to sync correctly to the Matriarch Sequencer and Arpeggiator, this Global Setting allows you to specify how many pulses are sent per quarter note (PPQN).
The Default is 4 PPQN / sixteenth note clock.

parameters.name: 0.4 Pitch Bend Range (Semitones)
parameters.description:
The effective pitch bend range of the Matriarch PITCH wheel can be set in semitone units, from 0 to 12. Twelve semitones is equal to one octave.
The Default is 2 semitones.

parameters.name: Keyboard Octave Transpose
parameters.description:
This setting is normally changed by pressing Hold+Play or Hold+Tab and extends the octave range of the keyboard.
The default is No transpose.

parameters.name: 4.1 Delayed KB Octave Transpose
parameters.description:
The keyboard Octave Up/Down functions (SHIFT + PLAY buttons for Octave Down, and SHIFT + TAP buttons for Octave Up) can be set to take effect immediately, transposing any notes that are currently being held on the keyboard, or their effect can be delayed, meaning that any currently held notes will not be transposed, but new notes played after using the Octave Up/Down function will sound at the new octave.
The Default is On.
Does not seem to have any effect in firmware V1.2.1

parameters.name: 0.2 Glide Type
parameters.description:
Glide Type determines the behavior of the Glide function.
LCR (Linear Constant Rate): The Glide time is dependent on the interval between notes; the larger the interval, the longer the delay time. This is the most commonly used type of Glide.
LCT (Linear Constant Time): The Glide time remains the same, regardless of the interval between notes.
EXP (Exponential): The Glide rate follows an exponential curve that begins with a fast rate, and slows as it nears the target note.
The default setting is LCR.

parameters.name: 0.3 Gated Glide
parameters.description:
Gated Glide causes the gradual gliding between notes to be started and stopped by the keyboard gate. When gated glide is On, the pitch CV only glides while a key is held. When Gated Glide is Off, the pitch CV will continue gliding to the target pitch at the current Glide rate, regardless of whether or not a key is held on Matriarch. The different behaviors are more distinct at longer glide times.
The Default is ON.

parameters.name: Legato Glide
parameters.description:
Legato Glide only produces the Glide effect when a new note is played while the previous note is still held down on the keyboard. To turn Legato Glide On, continue to press the [SHIFT] button while turning the GLIDE knob to the right. To turn Legato Glide Off, continue to press the [SHIFT] button while turning the GLIDE knob to the left.
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: 0.6+ Osc 2 Freq Knob Range
parameters.description:
The range of the Oscillator 2 FREQUENCY knob can be limited or expanded to a specific number of semitones, from 0 to 24.
The Default is 7 semitones (a musical Perfect Fifth).

parameters.name: 0.6+ Osc 3 Freq Knob Range
parameters.description:
The range of the Oscillator 3 FREQUENCY knob can be limited or expanded to a specific number of semitones, from 0 to 24.
The Default is 7 semitones (a musical Perfect Fifth).

parameters.name: 0.6+ Osc 4 Freq Knob Range
parameters.description:
The range of the Oscillator 4 FREQUENCY knob can be limited or expanded to a specific number of semitones, from 0 to 24.
The Default is 7 semitones (a musical Perfect Fifth).

parameters.name: Hard Sync Enable
parameters.description:
Reflects the status of the Oscillator "Sync Enable" panel button.
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: Osc 2 Hard Sync
parameters.description:
Reflects the status of the "Osc 2 Sync" panel button.
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: Osc 3 Hard Sync
parameters.description:
Reflects the status of the "Osc 3 Sync" panel button.
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: Osc 4 Hard Sync
parameters.description:
Reflects the status of the "Osc 4 Sync" panel button.
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: Delay Ping Pong
parameters.description:
Reflects the status of the Stereo Delay "Ping Pong" panel button.
The Default is Off.
With firmware V1.2.1, takes effect only after switching Matriarch off-on.

parameters.name: Delay Sync
parameters.description:
Reflects the status of the Stereo Delay "Sync" panel button.
The Default is Off.
With firmware V1.2.1, enabling sync takes effect immediately but does not switch off the button LED, disabling sync leaves the button LED lit and stays at the previous (synced) time/frequency.

parameters.name: 0.9 Delay Filter Brightness
parameters.description:
The output of the Stereo Delay can be set to either a Bright tone or a Dark tone.
The Default is Bright.

parameters.name: 0.10 Delay CV Sync-Bend
parameters.description:
The Delay Sync CV Bend parameter sets the behavior of the TIME CV inputs when the Delay is synchronized to internal or external clock. With Delay CV Sync Bend On, the TIME CV inputs “bend” the Delay Time relative to its currently synchronized tempo, up to plus-or-minus 33%. This can be useful for adding choral motion or warble to synchronized Delay effects. With Delay CV Sync Bend Off, the TIME CV inputs work identically to the front-panel TIME and SPACING knobs, selecting tempo-synced clock divisions of the of the currently synchronized tempo.
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: Tap-Tempo Clock Division Persistence
parameters.description:
I have no idea what this really does.
0 = Off, 1 = On (Default: 0 / Off)

parameters.name: Paraphony Mode
parameters.description:
Reflects the status of the "Paraphony Voice Mode" panel switch.
The Default is Off.
Changing this parameter has no effect.

parameters.name: 4.3 Paraphonic Unison
parameters.description:
When Paraphonic Unison is set to On, all four Matriarch oscillators will always sound, even when the PARAPHONY switch is set to VOICE MODE 2 or VOICE MODE 4, regardless of how many notes are held. When just one key is played, all four of the Matriarch oscillators will play from that key. When two keys are played, each key will play two of the Matriarch oscillators (1+2; 3+4). With the switch set to VOICE MODE 4, adding a third note assigns a new pitch to Oscillator 3, and adding a fourth note assigns a new pitch to Oscillator 4.
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: Multi Trig
parameters.description:
Reflects the status of the "Multi Trig" panel button.
The Default is Off.
In firmware V1.2.1, enabling it via Midi does not have any effect, but disabling it works but leaves the button LED lit.

parameters.name: 0.5 Pitch Variance
parameters.description:
Pitch Variance adds an adjustable amount of controlled randomness to the tuning of each note. The actual amount of detuning is applied randomly to each key press, from zero (no detuning), up to ± 40 cents of detuning per note. The maximum amount of detuning is set by this Pitch Variance parameter, the value is 0-400 (0 to +/- 40 cents in 0.1-cent increments).
Default: 0 / Off

parameters.name: 3.3 KB CV OUT Range
parameters.description:
The Matriarch keyboard generates a specific control voltage for every note played. The voltage range of this signal appears at the KB CV OUT jack on the Matriarch rear panel, and can be set to (-5V to +5V) or (0V to +10V) in order to accommodate another synthesizer or piece of electronic music gear.
The Default is -5V to +5V.

parameters.name: 3.4 Arp/Seq CV OUT Range
parameters.description: 0 = -5V to +5V, 1 = 0V to 10V (Default: 0 / -5 to +5)

parameters.name: 3.5 KB VEL OUT Range
parameters.description:
The Matriarch keyboard generates a specific control voltage based on the dynamics of every note played. The voltage range of this signal appears at the KB VEL OUT jack on the rear panel, and can be set to (0V to +5V) or (0V to +10V) in order to accommodate another synthesizer or piece of electronic music gear.
The Default is -5V to +5V.

parameters.name: 3.6 Arp/Seq VEL OUT Range
parameters.description:
The Matriarch Arpeggiator and Sequencer generate a specific control voltage based on the dynamics of every note played. The voltage range of this signal appears at the VEL OUT jack in the ARP / SEQ module on the front panel, and can be set to (0V to +5V) or (0V to +10V) in order to accommodate another synthesizer or piece of electronic music gear.
The Default is -5V to +5V.

parameters.name: 3.7 KB AT OUT Range
parameters.description:
The Matriarch keyboard generates a specific control voltage based on the amount of Aftertouch being applied. The voltage range of this signal appears at the KB AT OUT jack on the rear panel, and can be set to (0V to +5V) or (0V to +10V) in order to accommodate another synthesizer or piece of electronic music gear.
The Default is -5V to +5V.

parameters.name: 3.8 MOD WHL OUT Range
parameters.description:
The Matriarch Modulation (MOD) Wheel generates a specific control voltage based on its current position.  The voltage range of this signal appears at the MOD WHL OUT jack on the rear panel, and can be set to (0V to +5V) or (0V to +10V) in order to accommodate another synthesizer or piece of electronic music gear.
The Default is -5V to +5V.

parameters.name: 3.9 KB GATE OUT Range
parameters.description:
The Matriarch keyboard generates a specific control voltage, or gate, whenever a key is depressed. This gate voltage appears at the KB GATE OUT jack on the rear panel, and can be set to +5V or +10V, in order to accommodate another synthesizer or piece of electronic music gear.
The Default is +5V.

parameters.name: 3.10 Arp/Seq GATE OUT Range
parameters.description:
The Matriarch Arpeggiator and Sequencer generate a specific control voltage, or gate, whenever a non-legato note is played. This gate voltage appears at the VEL OUT jack in the ARP / SEQ module on the front panel, and can be set to +5V or +10V, in order to accommodate another synthesizer or piece of electronic music gear.
The Default is +5V.

parameters.name: 4.2 Round-Robin Mode
parameters.description:
This voice-assignment mode uses a cyclical pattern to assign each new note to a different oscillator. There are three available values: Off (C0), On with Reset (D0), and On (E0). When the value is set to Off, each new note is always assigned to lowest-numbered available oscillator. With the value set to On with Reset, the first note played is always assigned to Oscillator 1, and additional notes are assigned to the other remaining oscillators in a rotating fashion. With the value set to On, each note played is assigned to the next available oscillator.
The Default is First-Note Reset.

parameters.name: 4.5 Restore Stolen Voices
parameters.description:
When the PARAPHONY switch is set to VOICE MODE 2 or VOICE MODE 4, as the number of keys played exceeds the current number of available voices, older notes are “stolen” and replaced by newer notes. However, when this Global Setting is set to On, the oscillator(s) can resume playing the pitch of these stolen notes – as long as their respective keys are still being held on the keyboard. This can be very beneficial in mixing mono and poly playing techniques, such as holding a three-note chord, while using the remaining voice to play a mono-style trill.
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: 4.4 Update Unison on Note-Off
parameters.description:
This Global Setting is only available while the Paraphonic Unison Global Setting is set to On. When the Update Unison on Note-Off setting is on, all four oscillators are reassigned to the notes which are still playing whenever a key is released.
The Default is Off.

parameters.name: 0.7 Mod Oscillator Square Wave Polarity
parameters.description:
The square wave signal available from the Modulation section can be set to Unipolar – having only positive modulation above the zero line, or Bipolar – having equal amounts of both positive and negative modulation.
The Default is Bipolar.

parameters.name: 0.8 Noise Filter Cutoff
parameters.description:
Matriarch uses a 1-pole high-pass filter (VCF) to control the tonality and coloration of the analog Noise generator. Low-end content is removed as the filter cutoff frequency is increased.
The range is 0 to 16383 = dark to bright (Default: 0)

parameters.name: 4.7 Seq Random Repeats
parameters.description:
This parameter controls whether the Sequencer playback in Random direction will allow the same note/pitch to repeat on adjacent steps, or not.
The Default is Allow Repeats.

parameters.name: 5.1 ARP/SEQ CV OUT Mirrors KB CV
parameters.description:
This setting allows the CV OUT, GATE OUT, and VEL OUT jacks in the ARP/SEQ section of the panel to reflect the KB CV OUT, KB GATE OUT, and KB VEL OUT signals any time the Arp/Sequencer is not running.
The Default is Off.
